Navigation
Name Rascal/Expressions/Values/Number/max

Synopsis Determine the largest of two numeric values.
Function &T <: num max(&T <: num n, &T <: num m)
Description The largest of two numbers. The type of the result is the same as the type of the largest argument.
Examples 
rascal>import Number;
ok
rascal>max(12, 13);
int: 13
rascal>max(12, 13.5);
num: 13.5
rascal>max(12, 11.5);
num: 12
Questions
Question 1.
The type of max(10, -11) is

Question 2.
The type of max(18, -19.6040193930914874400) is

Question 3. 
max(1.36876824141042400, -12.843497214036849600) ==

Question 4. 
max(1.86199440434146400, ) == 12.13516619805617600

Question 5. 
max(-3.99584831141045200, ) == -3.99584831141045200
